      • checkIfExempted

        boolean checkIfExempted(java.lang.reflect.Method m)
        Checks if the method is to be exempted from testing or not.
        Parameters:
        m - the method to check for exemption
        Returns:
        false if the method shall be tested, true if the method is exempted and shall not be tested.

      • checkIfMethodThrowsSQLException

        boolean checkIfMethodThrowsSQLException(java.lang.Object LOB,
                                        java.lang.reflect.Method method)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Checks if the invocation of the method throws a SQLExceptio as expected.
        Parameters:
        LOB - the Object that implements the Blob interface
        method - the method that needs to be tested to ensure that it throws the correct exception
        Returns:
        true If the method throws the SQLException required after the free method has been called on the LOB object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

      • testGetCharacterStreamLongLastCharLatin

        public void testGetCharacterStreamLongLastCharLatin()
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.sql.SQLException
        Obtains streams from the Clob reading portions of the content, always including the last character in the Clob.

        This case fills the Clob with latin lowercase characters.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testGetCharacterStreamLongLastCharCJK

        public void testGetCharacterStreamLongLastCharCJK()
                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                  java.sql.SQLException
        Obtains streams from the Clob reading portions of the content, always including the last character in the Clob.

        This case fills the Clob with Chinese/Japanese/Korean characters.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getCharacterStreamLongLastChar

        private void getCharacterStreamLongLastChar(int id,
                                            int length,
                                            CharAlphabet alphabet)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.sql.SQLException
        Obtains streams from the Clob and makes sure we can always read the last char in the Clob.

        See DERBY-4060.

        Parameters:
        id - id of the Clob to use
        length - the length of the Clob
        alphabet - the alphabet used to create the content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from a stream fails
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong

      • testGetCharacterStreamLongOnLargeClob

        public void testGetCharacterStreamLongOnLargeClob()
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Test that Clob.getCharacterStream(long,long) works on CLOBs that are streamed from store. (DERBY-2891)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetCharacterStreamLongExceptionConditions

        public void testGetCharacterStreamLongExceptionConditions()
                                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tests the exceptions thrown by the getCharacterStream (long pos, long length) for the following conditions a) pos <= 0 b) pos > (length of LOB) c) length < 0 d) pos + length > (length of LOB).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • testGetCharacterStreamCreateClob

                                      throws java.lang.Exception

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetAsciiStreamClobUpdates

        public void testGetAsciiStreamClobUpdates()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests that the data updated in a Clob is always reflected in the InputStream got. Here the updates into the Clob are done using both an OutputStream obtained from this Clob as well as using Clob.setString.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetCharacterStreamClobUpdates

        public void testGetCharacterStreamClobUpdates()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Tests that the data updated in a Clob is always reflected in the Reader got. Here the updates are done using both a Writer obtained from this Clob and using Clob.setString.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public void testLockingAfterFree()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • insertAndFetchTest

        private void insertAndFetchTest(long length)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a Clob with the specified length, using a stream source, then fetches it from the database and checks the length.
        Parameters:
        length - number of characters in the Clob
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the source fails
        java.sql.SQLException - if something goes wrong

      • initializeLongClob

        private int initializeLongClob()
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Insert a row with a large clob into the test table. Read the row from the database and assign the clob value to clob.
        Returns:
        The id of the row that was inserted
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • executeParallelUpdate

        private void executeParallelUpdate(int id,
                                   boolean timeoutExpected)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Try to update the row with the given error. Flag a failure if a timeout occurs when not expected, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the row to be updated
        timeoutExpected - true if it is expected that the update times out
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getLastCharInStream

        public static char getLastCharInStream(java.io.Reader reader,
                                       int expectedCount)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Drains the stream and returns the last char read from the stream.
        Parameters:
        reader - stream to drain
        expectedCount - expected number of chars (remaining) in the stream
        Returns:
        The last char read.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if there are too many/few chars in the stream
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the stream fails
